A car (or automobile) is a wheeled motor vehicle used for transportation. Most definitions of the term specify that cars are designed to run primarily on roads, to have seating for one to eight people, to typically have four wheels, and to be constructed principally for the transport of people rather than goods.
A car is a wheeled, self-powered motor vehicle used for transportation and a product of the automotive industry.

Driving is the controlled operation and movement of a motorized vehicle with wheels, such as a car, truck, or bus.
